newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine cash maize steady to weaker.
newsitem.headline: Argentine cash maize steady to weaker.

text.p: Argentine cash maize was steady to was weaker midsession at the Buenos Aires Cereals Exchange on plentiful harvest supply, traders said.

The FAS elevator maize price in Buenos Aires lost $1 to $108. FAS elevator soybeans lost $1 to $307 in Rosario, following nearby prices in Chicago. Turnover in soybeans was moderate. Spot sunflower seed was steady at $230 in Buenos Aires and at $228 in Rosario in middling volume. It rose $2 in the southern ports of Bahia Blanca and Quequen to $228. Sunflower turnover was medium, with good demand from crushers to meet big export oil sales.
